parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
